text: Dubbed as the thinnest and lightest QWERTY BlackBerry, the Curve 8900 will feature built-in GPS with support of location-based services, WiFi with voice and data support, a 3.2 megapixel camera with digital zoom, image stabilization and flash, video recording and playback, a music player, a 3.5mm stereo headset jack and a microSD/SDHC memory card slot with a 256MB card included in the box. All this running on 512MHz processor. T-Mobile is expected to launch the BlackBerry Curve 8900 smartphone in mid-February. Price has not been revealed.
title: Research in Motion today announced that T-Mobile USA will start selling the new BlackBerry Curve 8900 smartphone to its customers.
